about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery:

about.name: Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery:

hasPart.assesses: Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery: | Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Pavement is particularly treacherous when it first begins to rain. Accumulations of dirt and oil mix with the rainwater, creating a greasy film on the roadway.

suggestedAnswer.text: If it has been raining several hours.

comment.text: If it has been raining several hours.

suggestedAnswer.text: If it has just begun to rain.

comment.text: If it has just begun to rain.

suggestedAnswer.text: If it has been raining for one to two hours.

comment.text: If it has been raining for one to two hours.

acceptedAnswer.text: If it has just begun to rain.

comment.text: If it has just begun to rain.

answerExplanation.text: Pavement is particularly treacherous when it first begins to rain. Accumulations of dirt and oil mix with the rainwater, creating a greasy film on the roadway.

comment.text: Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery: | Pavement is particularly treacherous when it first begins to rain. Accumulations of dirt and oil mix with the rainwater, creating a greasy film on the roadway.

hasPart.name: Drivers turning left must yield to:

about.name: Drivers turning left must yield to:

hasPart.assesses: Drivers turning left must yield to: | Drivers turning left must yield to: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers turning left must yield to oncoming vehicles that are driving straight ahead. A turning driver may only proceed when they can safely turn without affecting oncoming traffic.

comment.text: Overtaking cars.
Oncoming cars.
No one.
Oncoming cars.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers turning left must yield to oncoming vehicles that are driving straight ahead. A turning driver may only proceed when they can safely turn without affecting oncoming traffic.

comment.text: Drivers turning left must yield to: | Drivers turning left must yield to oncoming vehicles that are driving straight ahead. A turning driver may only proceed when they can safely turn without affecting oncoming traffic.

hasPart.text: When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

comment.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.

comment.text: Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.

comment.text: The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

comment.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

answerExplanation.text: When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

comment.text: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving: | When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

hasPart.name: It is against the law to enter an intersection when:

about.name: It is against the law to enter an intersection when:

hasPart.assesses: It is against the law to enter an intersection when: | It is against the law to enter an intersection when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Do not enter an intersection if you cannot get completely across before the traffic signal light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

suggestedAnswer.text: You can't get all the way across before the light turns red.

comment.text: You can't get all the way across before the light turns red.

suggestedAnswer.text: The light is flashing yellow and you didn't stop first.

comment.text: The light is flashing yellow and you didn't stop first.

suggestedAnswer.text: The light is yellow and you cannot stop safely.

comment.text: The light is yellow and you cannot stop safely.

acceptedAnswer.text: You can't get all the way across before the light turns red.

comment.text: You can't get all the way across before the light turns red.

answerExplanation.text: Do not enter an intersection if you cannot get completely across before the traffic signal light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

comment.text: It is against the law to enter an intersection when: | Do not enter an intersection if you cannot get completely across before the traffic signal light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

hasPart.name: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should consider each of the following, except for:

about.name: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should consider each of the following, except for:

hasPart.assesses: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should consider each of the following, except for: | If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should consider each of the following, except for: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Press yourself against the back of your seat and put your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

comment.text: Applying your brakes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Letting go of the steering wheel.

comment.text: Letting go of the steering wheel.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pressing your head firmly against the head restraint.

comment.text: Pressing your head firmly against the head restraint.

acceptedAnswer.text: Letting go of the steering wheel.

comment.text: Letting go of the steering wheel.

answerExplanation.text: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Press yourself against the back of your seat and put your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

comment.text: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should consider each of the following, except for: | If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Press yourself against the back of your seat and put your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

hasPart.text: At a white painted curb, you may stop only long enough to pick up or drop off passengers or mail.

suggestedAnswer.text: Loading zone for freight or passengers.

comment.text: Loading zone for freight or passengers.

suggestedAnswer.text: Loading zone for passengers or mail only.

comment.text: Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
Loading zone for freight only.

acceptedAnswer.text: Loading zone for passengers or mail only.

comment.text: Loading zone for passengers or mail only.

answerExplanation.text: At a white painted curb, you may stop only long enough to pick up or drop off passengers or mail.
